page.title: 11Ashford Water Trout Farm.
page.content: Before there was a trout farm at {Ashford Water,}it was marshland. The marsh had lots of{wildlife}such as owls, nightjars and frogs. Now that there is a trout farm there, the wildlife has changed dramatically. Today we see heron and kingfishers. There are no frogs, nightjars or owls. The owner has fifteen ponds of varied sized fish. He breeds the fish himself and sells them when they are about three years old. He sells the fish to stock{fishing lakes.}He also freezes some fish and gives some away to his friends. He has eight sheep to keep the grass down and a guard dog. In the future the owner hopes to build a house on the site now occupied by a caravan.
